review.description:
What can I say about this bodega but "Don't"!!  Don't stop here regardless of how hungry you are.  Don't even stop if it's the only breakfast spot between Williamsburg & Carroll Gardens that has available on street parking.  Think about it.....  There must be a reason why.

For twenty five years, regardless of the neighborhood, I have never been disappointed until today.  The bodegas all offer fresh grilled egg & bacon on a soft kaiser roll that is delish.  

Not Fort Greene Deli.  The bacon was so raw that I missed my turn trying to bite through the stubborn meat.  Yes, I do eat while driving in Brooklyn.  But my sandwich difficulties caused extra miles and quite a lot of horn blowing today.

There must be a rule with bodegas in NYC that the person behind the counter isn't allowed to smile.  But you can feel the underneath warmth in most, especially if you're a regular or mention the Giants or the Mets.

Not so here.  There was no aura of warmth below the surface.  I was left with the feeling that what was there was "Give me your money & leave."  So that's exactly what I did.
review.author: Carol S.
